title: Change default mode when opening a message in "Sent" folder
content:
When I click to open a message in the local sent folder, it defaults to "Edit Draft Message", which I hate; it's too easy to accidentally resend the message causing confusion. I want to set the default to "Open message in new window" or "Open message in new tab". I have not found the way to do this. What am I missing?

It's nice to have the option to "Edit Draft Message," but I rarely want that. I'll select it from the context menu when needed.
creator: tech77

title: Account on multiple computers with different setup
content: I have my gmail account on Thunderbird on Windows 10 and Pop_OS. The Windows has local folders the Pop does not. What happens to the emails on the machine without? I was trying to make room on Windows for a dualboot. I copied everthing to usb then accidentally deleted my user files. 1)How do I recover the local folders from the usb? And/or 2)Do I even need to since I have Thunderbird on Pop? My concern is that, since I set up local folders on Windows, that those emails never got sent to the Pop machine. Otherwise, they all might be there and I just have to locate them which means I don't have to restore the Windows emails.
creator: willpfister

title: Thunderbird is very slow in loading messages
content: Whein I click anyone of the messages in mail gmail mailbox, it takes sevral seconds befor eI can see it. I already tried to rebuild message index but the problem remains
creator: SERI.MANUEL

title: Can't send emails on one of my computers
content:
I don't have any problem sending messages on my PC at home just on my laptop. I have windows 11 on both. 

I get a message...

connection to outgoing server (SMTP) timed out.

another time I got the message

'sending failed. error while sending mail. outgoing server (SMTP) error. server responded impout 006.msg.chrl.charter.net cmsmtp 50.201.174.29 blocked please see... https//spectrum.net/support/internet/ understanding-email-error-codes for more information AUP#Out - 1130

I looked up 1130 in spectrum’s website but I couldn't figure out what it was saying. I also called spectrum to see if they could help but they couldn't help and just referred me back to you guys.

my outgoing connection is description - charter communications server name - mobile.charter.net Port - 587 Security - normal password user name - robinclaire1@charter.net (or any of my other email addresses)

I have 5 email addresses. and I can't send from any of them. jesusfollower1@charter.net robinclaire1@charter.net climbthewell@charter.net robinc12step@charter.net jerryg0583@charter.net

please help. thank you robin ps - I had a terrible time with thunderbird trying to load a profile from another computer. This failed utterly and I had to have someone help me to reload thunderbird on this laptop. I've never had luck with sending emails ever since it was reloaded. To reload, I had to search for 'thunderbird' on my computer over and over again until there was no 'thunderbirds' to delete - that included several thunderbird downloads as well. I wiped my laptop clean of all thunderbirds and then it could finally be downloaded. But I didn't think to try to send a message when my tech guy was there so I didn’t catch that I couldn’t send them.

thanks again.

r
creator: RobinClaire

title: ошибка при отправке сообщения

title: Entering "manual config" when adding new e-mails
content:
Hi all! I use Thunderbird on my Desktop for work-realted e-mails, therefore I have different e-mail accounts linked to it. I recently bought a new laptop and when I tried to enter my work-emails, by pressing "New Account" -> "Email Account" I am met with a new interface that does not provide an option for the manual configuration of IMAP, Incoming Server, Outgoing Server etc. Without them, I cannot access my work emails.

Can anyone help me how I can access these configs? Or the previous interface?

Unfortunately, the screeshot is in german, but it says "Exchange auth error"
creator: ruthnerjakob

title: TB 140.4.0esr (64-bit) crashes in Windows 11
content:
